reviewText: I am an advanced exerciser and an avid Cathe Friedrich exerciser.  Cathe is the best!  The Imax 2 workout is about an hour long and takes you through 10 cycles with a step aerobic section and a more intense section.  I had to pause the tape at times to get the foot patterns of the cycles but once I got it all I love the workout.  At the end you are dripping with sweat.  The Cardio & Weights workout is just as good.  You do three cycles with step aerobics and weights.  This is also a heart pumping workout!!  You get totally worked out!  I love this dvd.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Cardio & Weights is my favorite Cathe's DVD. The music is uplifting and the routine is plain fun!! It's also doable as I believe is only 50 min. long. This is more of an intermediate workout. Cathe does cycles of cardio using the step and also weights. I have so much fun with this workout!!Imax 2 is also Excellent. This is a cardio workout that consists of 10 intervals. Now this DVD is TOUGH... it will definitely test your cardio capacity. Some of the step routines are pretty advanced. I love doing IMAX2 on Saturday mornings when I well rested :)Cathe definitely puts together the BEST workout DVDs. I've been doing her DVDs for about 2 months and I'm seeing GREAT results!!! If you want results then Cathe is for you!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Let me just start my review by saying that this is not a workout video for beginners. For advanced exercisers, though, this is an excellent addition to your collection.Imax 2 is a step aerobics workout. After a warm-up, it is arranged in 10 interval cycles. Each interval consists of a step routine, an intensity blast, and a short recovery period. The step routines technically are pretty easy. What makes this video challenging is the high intensity and high impact moves in the blasts. Even though it is tough, Imax 2 is a lot of fun. This is due in large part to Cathe's encouraging personality. The music is very good, featuring some recognizable songs. The workout ends with a cool-down and stretch period.Cardio and Weights is a circuit workout. There are four step cardio segments that are each followed by compound weights and heavy weight training. There is a segment of ab exercises after the final bit of weight training, followed by a cool-down and stretch. The music is also very excellent in this workout.This is pretty expensive for an exercise video, but it has been well-worth the purchase price for me. Not only are the workouts themselves great, Cathe's DVDs come with a variety of premixes that allow you great flexibility when it comes to your workout.You won't be disappointed here!
summary: Wowza! An awesome video for advanced exercisers
Title: N/A

reviewText: IMAX 2I really wanted to like this work out, but you really need an extra amount of space for the cardio portion with the stepper, there are lots of jumping over/around/behind the stepper etc.  I am able to do many other step workouts, but there just isn't enough room for this one.Also this is high impact on the knees, probably one of the highest impact videos I own.I don't recommend it if you have any type of knee problems, this could be very damaging.Cardio & weightsTo keep it short, this reminds me of a better version of the older Firm cross-trainer videos. The cardio segments on the box are better though, and the compound weight lifting segments in between are different & just as effective.
summary: Great cardio, but if you have a small room, too hard to do the foot work.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of my favorite Cathe DVDs. There's IMAX 2, an interval workout, and Cardio & Weights, a circuit workout. You can certainly improve your cardiovascular endurance with these workouts. There's not enough weight work to really build muscle. I found the weight work was also good for keeping my heart rate up.IMAX 2IMAX 2 has 10 intervals. Each interval consists of a step routine, an intensity blast and a recovery period.Why I loved IMAX 2:**the rockin' music. I love songs that I recognize and this workout is filled with them. When I hear music I love, I'm inspired to workout harder and longer. I don't care for the music in Cathe's later workouts, so listening to this is a special treat.**the fun step routines. I must be more coordinated than I thought, since I found these routines very easy to learn. You do each little pattern a total of 6 times.**the recovery periods after each intensity blast. Yes, I'm an advanced exerciser, but I welcome the recovery periods, since they enable me to recover, gather my thoughts and get really psyched for the next interval.**my heart rate is up there, even though I'm modifying most of the high impact moves to low impact.Some things to note about IMAX 2:**it's truly advanced. It's very high impact and Cathe doesn't give any modifications. I am very familiar with Cathe's choreography so I find it very easy to do a lower impact move.CARDIO & WEIGHTSThis workout has 4 step routines, followed by 2-3 weight routines, you then do some abs, followed by a relaxing stretch.Why I loved Cardio & Weights:**the music. There's everything from an Elvis song to "Build Me Up Buttercup." I can't help but sing along.**it's deceptively hard! I am in the midst of doing a barre-type rotation, which incorporates high reps/light weights and a lot of stretching. Normally, I do splits with heavy weights. So you would think this workout would be easy for me - NOT!**Cathe tells us what weights she's using. I couldn't match her weights, but it was helpful for a guide.**the 8 minute ab section is hard, and I really felt it in my entire core.**Cathe's gentle form reminders and encouragement.I highly recommend this fun and effective DVD for anyone wanting to improve
summary: Fun and intense calorie burners from Cathe!
